question: What is the rate of epimutations in C. elegans?
ideal_answer: In C. elegans epimutations arise spontaneously at a rate approximately 25 times greater than DNA sequence changes.

snippets.text: We show that epimutations arise spontaneously at a rate approximately 25 times greater than DNA sequence changes and typically have short half-lives of two to three generations.

exact_answer: 25 times greater than DNA sequence changes
